org.gamelink.game

Class Cram

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gamelink.game.Cram

  • public class Cram
extends java.lang.Object
    The Cram class is used by an algorithm to play the cram game. The Cram class attempts to connect the algorithms with each other and then proceeds to regulate the playing of the game. The Cram class uses the Link class to send messages between the players of the game. The Cram class is responsible for validating and applying moves made by the algorithm, as well as regulating the play of the games (who moves when).
    Since:
    2015-07-27

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String CONFIGFILE
      The CONFIGFILE constant defines the file path of the Cram properties file.
      Link connection
      The connection is an instance of the Link classes used to connect both algorithms over their local area network using the hosts IP address.
      boolean displayBoardProperty
      The displayBoardProperty is a boolean setting that determines if the game is to display the gameBoard after each move of the match.
      int[][] gameBoard
      The gameBoard array is a two-dimensional integer representation of the game board.
      boolean gameOverFlag
      The gameOverFlag is used to signify that the game has ended, so that the painter can display the winner an score of the match.
      int heightProperty
      The heightProperty defines the width of the gameBoard.
      int initCellsProperty
      The initCellsProperty defines the number of random cells that will be placed prior to the beginning of the game.
      int MAXTIMELIMIT
      The MAXTIMELIMIT property is used to virtualy turn off the timeLimit; if the user specifies a time limit of 0 in the properties file the time limit will be set to the MAXTIMELIMIT value, essentialy turnning it off.
      int moveDelayProperty
      The MoveDelayProperty adds a delay (in seconds) between each move of the match allowing observers to keep up with the playing of the game.
      int opponentPlayerNumber
      The opponentPlayerNumber Integer is used to identify the opponent player's number.
      org.gamelink.game.CramPainter painter
      The painter is used to paint the gameBoard on the JFrame
      int playerNumber
      The playerNumber integer is used to identify each player of the game.
      int RANDOMCELLVALUE
      The RANDOMCELLVALUE is the integer value used to represent a randomly placed cell on the gameBoard.
      int timeLimitProperty
      The timeLimitProperty limits the amount of time (in seconds) an algorithm may take to make a move.
      int widthProperty
      The widthProperty defines the width of the gameBoard.

    • Field Detail

      • playerNumber

        public int playerNumber
        The playerNumber integer is used to identify each player of the game. This value is retrieved from the player prior to the start of the game. Player 1 is the host of the match and moves first, Player 2 is the client and connects to player 1 to start the game.

      • opponentPlayerNumber

        public int opponentPlayerNumber
        The opponentPlayerNumber Integer is used to identify the opponent player's number. It is always opposite if the playerNumber.

      • connection

        public Link connection
        The connection is an instance of the Link classes used to connect both algorithms over their local area network using the hosts IP address. A connection must be established prior to the start of the game

      • gameBoard

        public int[][] gameBoard
        The gameBoard array is a two-dimensional integer representation of the game board. it can be accessed by the algorithms to make decisions about move.

      • RANDOMCELLVALUE

        public final int RANDOMCELLVALUE
        The RANDOMCELLVALUE is the integer value used to represent a randomly placed cell on the gameBoard.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONFIGFILE

        public final java.lang.String CONFIGFILE
        The CONFIGFILE constant defines the file path of the Cram properties file. The properties file lists a series of properties that may be changed to alter aspects of the game to the users liking.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • timeLimitProperty

        public int timeLimitProperty
        The timeLimitProperty limits the amount of time (in seconds) an algorithm may take to make a move. Failing to meet this time restriction will result in an invalid move. This property is listed within the Cram.properties file and is set to 30 seconds by default.

      • MAXTIMELIMIT

        public final int MAXTIMELIMIT
        The MAXTIMELIMIT property is used to virtualy turn off the timeLimit; if the user specifies a time limit of 0 in the properties file the time limit will be set to the MAXTIMELIMIT value, essentialy turnning it off.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • displayBoardProperty

        public boolean displayBoardProperty
        The displayBoardProperty is a boolean setting that determines if the game is to display the gameBoard after each move of the match. This property is listed within the Cram.properties file and is set to true by default.

      • moveDelayProperty

        public int moveDelayProperty
        The MoveDelayProperty adds a delay (in seconds) between each move of the match allowing observers to keep up with the playing of the game. this property is listed within the Cram.properties file and is set to 3 seconds by default.

      • initCellsProperty

        public int initCellsProperty
        The initCellsProperty defines the number of random cells that will be placed prior to the beginning of the game. This property is listed in the Cram.properites file and is set to 2 by default.

      • widthProperty

        public int widthProperty
        The widthProperty defines the width of the gameBoard. This property is listed in the Cram.properties file and is 5 by default

      • heightProperty

        public int heightProperty
        The heightProperty defines the width of the gameBoard. This property is listed in the Cram.properties file and is 5 by default

      • painter

        public org.gamelink.game.CramPainter painter
        The painter is used to paint the gameBoard on the JFrame

      • gameOverFlag

        public boolean gameOverFlag
        The gameOverFlag is used to signify that the game has ended, so that the painter can display the winner an score of the match.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cram

        public Cram()
        The Cram constructor is responsible for setting up everything needed for the game to start. This includes reading the properties from the config file and configuring the game accordingly. The constructor method prompts the user for their player number and sets the playerNumber and opponentPlayerNumber values accordingly. Additionally the constructor sets the playerNumber of the connection establishing the player as either the host or the client.

      • Cram

        public Cram(int pNum)
        This Cram constructor acts the same way as other Cram constructor however player number is passed as a parameter instead of command prompt.
        Parameters:
        The - playerNumber of the player
        See Also:
        Cram#Constrctor()

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public int[][] getBoard()
        The getBoard method retrieves the current configuration of the gameboard.
        Returns:
        The the current configuration of the gameBoard.

      • getTurn

        public int getTurn()
        The getTurn method is used by the painter to determine whose turn it is.
        Returns:
        the player Number of the player who's turn it is.

      • getGameOverFlag

        public boolean getGameOverFlag()
        The getGameOverFlag method is used by the painter to determine if the game is over so that it may change the message displayed in the window.
        Returns:
        The gameover flag

      • setCell

        public void setCell(int[][] board,
           int y,
           int x,
           int value)
        The setCell method sets the value of an individual cell on a board. If that board is the game board, the display is updated to reflect the changes.
        Parameters:
        the - y coordinate on the gameBoard of the cell to be changed
        the - x coordinate on the gameBoard of the cell to be changed
        the - integer value to be placed in the cell of the gameBoard this value may be a player number (1 or 2) or 6 for a random cell

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(int[][] board)
        The setBoard method is used to change the gameBoard and update the display

      • setGameOver

        public void setGameOver()
        The setGameOver method is used to set the gameOverFlag value to true, to signify to the painter class that the game is over. It also updates the display.

      • setPlayerNumber

        public void setPlayerNumber(int pNum)
        The setPlayerNumber method sets the values of the playerNumber, opponentPlayerNumbers, and the playerNumber of the connection.
        Parameters:
        The - player number of the player

      • getUserPlayerNumber

        public void getUserPlayerNumber()
        The getUserPlayerNumber method prompts the user for their player number and continues to do so until a valid player number is entered (1 or 2).

      • printConfig

        public void printConfig()
        The print Config method prints the configuration of the game as specified by the Cram.properties file.

      • printScore

        public void printScore()
        The printScore method prints the final score of the game as well as the winner of the match.

      • readConfigFile

        public void readConfigFile()
        The readConfigFile method reads and retrieves the properties from the Cram.properties file and sets the corresponding instance variables as specified in the file

      • initializeGame

        public void initializeGame()
        The initializeGame method is responsible for configuring the gameBoard and syncronizing both Players. The initial board is configured on player1 side, The board along with the properties of the game is then sent to player2 so they both begin with the game settings.Pplayer2 validates the received settings and responds with a message indicating that the validation was successful. Once complete the game may begin.

      • calcScore

        public int[] calcScore()
        The calcScore method calculates the current score of the game using the current configuration of the game board.
        Returns:
        an integer array containing the score of player1, the score of player2, and the playerNumber of the winner.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        The isGameOver method determines if the game is over.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over, false otherwise.

      • areBoardsEqual

        public boolean areBoardsEqual(int[][] board1,
                     int[][] board2)
        The areBoardsEqual method compares two game boards to determine if they are equal, this method is used in the process of validating a move.
        Parameters:
        an - 2d integer representation of a game board
        another - 2d integer representation of a game board
        Returns:
        true if the boards are equal (same values), false otherwise.

      • arrayToString

        public java.lang.String arrayToString(int[][] board)
        The arrayToString methos converts a 2d integer array representation of a board to a string, allowing it to be sent via the Link connection. This method effectivly revearses the actions preformed in the stringToArray method.
        Parameters:
        The - 2d integer array representation of the board to be converted to a String.
        Returns:
        The string representation of the board, with values seppparated with the '|' character.
        See Also:
        stringToArray(String message)

      • stringToArray

        public int[][] stringToArray(java.lang.String message)
        The stringToarray method converts the String representation of a board to the 2d integer representation. This method effectivly reverses the actions performed in the arrayToString method.
        Parameters:
        The - String representation of the board to be converted to a 2d integer array.
        Returns:
        The 2d integer array representation of the game board
        See Also:
        arrayToString(int[][] board)

      • copyArray

        public int[][] copyArray(int[][] array)
        Creates a copy of an 2d integer array
        Parameters:
        A - 2d integer array to be copied
        Returns:
        The copy of the 2d integer array

      • constructMessage

        public java.lang.String constructMessage(java.lang.String move,
                                int[][] oldBoard,
                                int[][] newBoard)
        The constructMessage method formats the message to be sent to the opponents, this message will represent the a move made by the player and will include the move, the game board before the move was applied, and the game board after the move was applied.
        Parameters:
        The - move made by the player in the form of a String
        The - board prior to applying the move in the form a 2d integer array.
        The - board after the application of the move in the form of a 2d integer array
        Returns:
        The message to be sent to the opponent in the form of a String containing, the String representations of move, the old board, and the new board all sepatated by the ':' delimiter

      • deconstructMessage

        public java.lang.String[] deconstructMessage(java.lang.String message)
        The deconstructMessage method is responsible for seggmenting the message sent by the opponent player into 3 parts.
        Parameters:
        The - message sent by the opponent to represent their move
        Returns:
        a array containing 3 Strings, the opponents move, the board before the opponent's move, and the board after the opponents move.

      • constructInitialMessage

        public java.lang.String constructInitialMessage()
        The constructInitialMessages is responsible for formatting the message sent by player 1 to player 2 to syncronize the initial properties of the game. These properties include the number of initial cells, the width and height of the gameBoard, as well as the configuration of the gameBoard
        Returns:
        The message to be sent to player2 in the form of a String containing the String representation of the gameBoard, the initCellsProperty, the heightProperty and the widthProperty, all separated by the ':' delimiter

      • validateAndApplyMove

        public boolean validateAndApplyMove(java.lang.String opponentMove,
                           int[][] opponentOldBoard,
                           int[][] opponentNewBoard)
                             throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        The validateAndApplyMove method is used to validate the move sent by the opponent player. If the move is determined to be a valid move the move is then applied to the gameBoard
        Parameters:
        The - move made by the opponent in the form of a string
        The - opponents board prior to the move being applied
        The - opponents board after the move is applied
        Returns:
        true if the opponents move is a valid one and was successfully applied to the gameBoard, false if otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the move entered does not meet the standard (a 4 digit number)

      • validateAndApplyMove

        public boolean validateAndApplyMove(java.lang.String playerMove)
                             throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        The validateAndApplyMove method is used to validate a move prior to it being sent to the opponent player. If the move is determined to be a valid move the move is then applied to the gameBoard and sent to the opponent
        Parameters:
        The - move made by the player in the form of a string
        Returns:
        true if the player's move is a valid one and was successfully applied to the gameBoard, false if otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the move entered does not meet the standard (a 4 digit number)

      • validateProperties

        public void validateProperties(java.lang.String initCells,
                      java.lang.String height,
                      java.lang.String width)
        The validateProperties method is used to validate the synchronization message sent by the opposing player. A response is then sent to the opposing player to signify if the properties match their own.
        Parameters:
        The - initial cells property sent by the opposing player in the message
        The - height property sent by the opposing in the message
        The - width Property sent by opposing in the message

      • startGame

        public void startGame(java.lang.Class<?> algo,
             boolean useOwnIpAddress)
        The startGame method attempts to establish a connection between player 1 and player 2 using the Link class. Once a connect is established the game is then started.
        Parameters:
        The - user-created class containing the algorithm which will act as a player of the game.
        A - boolean value signifying that the player wishes to connect to another player on the same IP addess
        See Also:
        Link

      • gameLoop

        public void gameLoop(java.lang.Class<?> algo)
        The gameLoop method is responsible for controlling the flow of the game. After the game is initialized using the initializeGame method, the players algorithms are called and moves are sent back and forth between players using the makeMove and SendMove methods
        Parameters:
        The - user-created class containing the algorithm which will act as a player of the game.

      • endGame

        public void endGame(java.lang.String move)
        The endGame method is used to clean up after the game. First the final configuration of the gameBoard is printed, followed by the reason why the game is over and the final score of the game. Finally the connection between the players in closed.
        Parameters:
        the - String representation of the last move of the match.

      • makeMove

        public boolean makeMove(java.lang.String move)
        The makeMove method is responsible for validating, applying and sending a move made by the players algorithm.
        Parameters:
        The - move made by the players algorithm in String form.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over after the application of the move, false otherwise.

      • getMove

        public boolean getMove()
        The getMove method is responsible for retrieving, validating, and applying a move made by the opposing player's algorithm
        Returns:
        true if the game is over after the application of the move, false otherwise.

      • runAlgo

        public static java.lang.String runAlgo(java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                       Cram game)
        The runAlgo method utilizes the CramAlgoInvoker Class to call the user-created algorithm. This algorithm returns the players move in the form of a String.
        Parameters:
        The - method representation of the user-created algorithm
        The - instance of the game of Cram currently being played
        Returns:
        The move returned by the users algorithm in the form of a String
        See Also:
        CramAlgoInvoker
